intro: Pilosella hoppeana subsp. sicula, commonly known as Sicilian mouse-ear, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as slopes and meadows. Its morphology reflects adaptations to its arid and semi-arid native range.
